verse.roman:
taṁ ca brahmarṣayo 'bhyetya
hayamedhena bhārata
yathāvad dīkṣayāṁ cakruḥ
puruṣārādhanena ha

synonyms: tam—him (Lord Indra); ca—and; brahma-ṛṣayaḥ—the great saints and brāhmaṇas; abhyetya—approaching; hayamedhena—with an aśvamedha sacrifice; bhārata—O King Parīkṣit; yathāvat—according to the rules and regulations; dīkṣayām cakruḥ—initiated; puruṣa-ārādhanena—which consists of worship of the Supreme Person, Hari; ha—indeed.
translation: O King, when Lord Indra reached the heavenly planets, the saintly brāhmaṇas approached him and properly initiated him into a horse sacrifice [aśvamedha-yajña] meant to please the Supreme Lord.
